intro: Melilotoides gordeievii, commonly known as the Siberian melilot, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in areas of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Melilotoides gordeievii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine and steppe environments.
